intro: Plethadenia cubensis, commonly known as Cuban plethadenia, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Plethadenia cubensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution.
